page.title: 12HOUSING (CONT)
page.content: The majority of houses were of the 3-bedroomed semi-detached type with a minority of terraced housing. Less than 30% had garages adjacent to the property although several lock-up garages were provided nearby. Both front & back gardens were small & compact but adequate recreational space was available elsewhere(Playgrounds & grass commons). Building materials consisted almost entirely of brickwork with clay tiles. Asizeable proportion of family homes (23%) provided rented rooms. In general the housing was in a good state of repair but there were some indications of neglect, such as flaking paint, loose drainpipes & rotting doors & window-frames. One major source of concern was the slowness & inefficiency of local council repairs.
